  <div style="color: #999999; font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 10pt; text-align: left;">
    <span>[[Doradus_Configuration_and_Operation|Doradus Configuration and Operation]]</span> : <span>[[Doradus_Configuration_Files|Doradus Configuration Files]]</span> : <span>[[Configuration_Parameters_in_doradus.yaml|Configuration Parameters in doradus.yaml]]</span> : Background Tasks Parameters</div>
  <hr />
  <div style="color: #4F81BD; font-family: &quot;Museo For Dell Regular&quot;; font-size: 11pt; font-style: italic; font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-top: 10pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0KG0HA">Background Tasks Parameters</span></div>
  <div style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-left: 18pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0JG0HA">max_node_tasks: 2</span></div>
  <div style="font-family: &quot;Museo Sans For Dell Regular&quot;; font-size: 11pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-left: 36pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0IG0HA">Defines the maximum number of tasks that can be launched concurrently on one Doradus node. If there is no node that can launch a task since all the nodes are busy with </span><span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">max_node_tasks</span> each, then the task is skipped, and may be scheduled next time.</div>
  <div style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-left: 18pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0HG0HA"># task_exec_delay: 5</span></div>
  <div style="font-family: &quot;Museo Sans For Dell Regular&quot;; font-size: 11pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-left: 36pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0GG0HA">Defines the minimum interval (in seconds) between the scheduled time and actual start of the task. This delay is used for Doradus nodes to synchronize and to decide which node would perform the task. After this initial delay, the task may be delayed once more for maximum </span><span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">task_exec_delay</span> seconds, so actual time interval between scheduled time and actual task start time may be between <span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">task_exec_delay</span> and 2 * <span style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal;">task_exec_delay</span> seconds.</div>
  <div style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-left: 18pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0FG0HA">task_restarts: 2</span></div>
  <div style="font-family: &quot;Museo Sans For Dell Regular&quot;; font-size: 11pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-left: 36pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0EG0HA">Number of attempts to restart a task if it was interrupted due to an internal error. The task will not be restarted if an external error (like server node fault) occurs.</span></div>
  <div style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-left: 18pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0DG0HA">check_interrupting_interval: 10</span></div>
  <div style="font-family: &quot;Museo Sans For Dell Regular&quot;; font-size: 11pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-left: 36pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0CG0HA">Defines the interval (in seconds) between consequent analysis of whether a task that is executing by this node was interrupted by user request.</span></div>
  <div style="color: #4A442A; font-family: Consolas; font-size: 9.5pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-left: 18pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0BG0HA">default_schedule:</span></div>
  <div style="font-family: &quot;Museo Sans For Dell Regular&quot;; font-size: 11pt; margin-bottom: 12pt; margin-left: 36pt; margin-top: 12pt;"><span id="wwpID0E0AG0HA">Global default schedule used for all tasks for all applications and tables. The value is a cron expression (example: “0 0 31 10 *”). The default is null, which means no tasks are automatically scheduled.</span></div>
</div>
